attributes.action: Abandon plans he has with John Reid to give police new powers under the anti-terror law to stop and question anyone at random, then fining and criminalising those who do not comply.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the proposals, officers would have the right to ask people about their identities and movements and failure to comply could lead to criminal charges or a hefty fine. We are more likely to be run down by a bus than killed by a bomb, so is it worth the erosion of our rights?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
